subject: [Lab 12] Q2: What Would SQL print?
content:
Q2: What Would SQL print?

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q2: What Would SQL print? in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: Im trying to open the fal9data.sql file but when i click on it, it does nothing. I have been opening all my files with IDLE software so far in this course. I can open lab12.sql also in IDLE, its only the data file which won't open. Does this mean I have to download a new sqlite version or just a text editor like atom or sublime?

follow-ups.feedback: The file opens fine for me. Perhaps re-extract it from the zip?
You could also just open it in a different text editor—.sql files are just text files with SQL commands inside, so it should read just fine.
Nope, but I would recommend giving it a go for practice.
You are trying to run the terminal command within the SQLite interpreter make sure you exit first using `.quit` before you run that command.

threads.question: how can I submit this question?

follow-ups.feedback: is there somewhere I can put the result of print and submit?
not sure what you mean exactly but to test and submit, you can use the regular ok commands. For example,                python3 ok -q obedience  or                python3 ok --submit

threads.question: I had to download an official precompiled SQLite since I was encountering issues running sqlite_shell.py. When I run ".schema" nothing is returned and when I type "SELECT * FROM students LIMIT 20," I get an error (see below). Can someone help me solve the issue? Thank you :)  ![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjzlnp9jc7an29b%2Fk3b0393yg7lh%2Ferror1.PNG)

follow-ups.feedback: Try running the command `.read lab12.sql` inside of the sqlite3 prompt before you run other commands.
Actually, that command _is_ supposed to work with the SQLite binary. It’s in the man page and everything.
Nevermind -- I figured it out. I was in the wrong folder and so couldn't access the data :(( Thank you!
